Class Engine

java.lang.Object
Engine
public class Engine extends Object
Represents the main engine for the chess game, handling game logic, state transitions, move validation, and communication with the GUI.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Engine(ChessBoard cb)
    Constructs the engine with an initial chessboard state.

    • setGameGUI

      public void setGameGUI(GameGUI gui)
      Sets the GUI for the engine.
      Parameters:
      gui - the GameGUI instance to associate with the engine

    • newGame

      public void newGame()
      Starts a new game, resetting the chessboard and match state.

    • handleInput

      public void handleInput(Position pos)
      Handles player input from the GUI, processing a chessboard position.
      Parameters:
      pos - the position selected by the player

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame(String savePath) throws IOException
      Saves the current game state to a predefined file.
      Parameters:
      savePath - Save to given path
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during file writing

    • loadGame

      public void loadGame(String loadPath) throws IOException
      Loads a saved game from a predefined file.
      Parameters:
      loadPath - load from given path
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during file reading

    • executeMove

      public void executeMove(Move move)
      Executes a valid move on the chessboard, updating piece positions.
      Parameters:
      move - the move to execute

    • updateState

      public void updateState()
      Updates the game state after a move, including board snapshots and player turns.

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove(Move move)
      Validates if a move complies with chess rules.
      Parameters:
      move - the move to validate
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid, false otherwise

    • findKing

      public Position findKing()
      Finds the position of the king for the current player.
      Returns:
      the position of the king

    • getBoard

      public ChessBoard getBoard()
      Retrieves the current chess board.
      Returns:
      The current ChessBoard object associated with this game.
